canonical_explanation.text: Geometric constructions involve creating precise figures using only a ruler (straightedge) and compass. Triangle constructions require specific measurements: SSS (three sides), SAS (two sides and included angle), ASA (two angles and included side), and RHS (right angle, hypotenuse, and one side). Quadrilateral constructions build on triangle methods by dividing the shape into triangles. Special constructions include angle bisectors, perpendicular bisectors, and standard angles. These techniques form the foundation of classical Euclidean geometry.
rules: SSS construction requires three side lengths that satisfy the triangle inequality theorem
SAS construction uses two sides and the angle between them
ASA construction uses two angles and the side between them
RHS construction is specific to right triangles with hypotenuse and one side
Quadrilaterals can be constructed by dividing them into triangles using a diagonal
Angle bisector divides an angle into two equal parts
Perpendicular bisector passes through the midpoint at 90 degrees
Standard angles can be constructed: 60° (equilateral triangle), 90° (perpendicular), 120° (supplement of 60°), 30° (bisect 60°), 45° (bisect 90°)

questions.question_text: Which construction method would you use to construct a triangle when all three side lengths are given?

options.text: Two sides and the included angle
Two angles and the included side

questions.question_text: In SAS construction of a triangle, which element must be given?
RHS construction can only be used for right-angled triangles.
An angle bisector divides an angle into _____ equal parts.
Which angle is constructed first when creating a 30° angle using ruler and compass?
A perpendicular bisector of a line segment passes through its midpoint at 90 degrees.
A parallelogram has how many pairs of parallel sides?
A rhombus is a quadrilateral with all _____ sides equal.
A regular hexagon has six equal sides and six equal angles.
In ASA construction, what is the element between the two given angles?
To construct a 45° angle, you first construct a _____ angle and then bisect it.
A trapezium has exactly one pair of parallel sides.
Which quadrilateral has all sides equal and all angles 90°?
Each interior angle of a regular hexagon measures _____ degrees.
A 120° angle can be constructed by drawing an equilateral triangle and extending one side.
What is the angle at which the perpendicular bisector intersects the line segment?
In RHS construction, RHS stands for Right angle, Hypotenuse, and _____.

ordering_items: Draw a base line equal to one side length
From one endpoint, draw an arc with radius equal to the second side
From the other endpoint, draw an arc with radius equal to the third side
Mark the intersection point of the two arcs
Join both endpoints to the intersection point
correct_answer: Draw a base line equal to one side length
From one endpoint, draw an arc with radius equal to the second side
From the other endpoint, draw an arc with radius equal to the third side
Mark the intersection point of the two arcs
Join both endpoints to the intersection point
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps for constructing a triangle using SSS method in the correct order.

options.text: The sum of two shorter sides is less than the longest side

questions.question_text: A triangle with sides 3 cm, 4 cm, and 8 cm cannot be constructed. Why?

match_pairs.right: Right angle, hypotenuse, and one side

questions.question_text: Match the construction method with the required elements.
When bisecting an angle of 80°, what will be the measure of each resulting angle?
To construct a rectangle, you need to know at least two adjacent sides.
To construct a 15° angle, first construct a _____ angle and then bisect it twice.

options.text: Two adjacent sides and the included angle
Both diagonals and the angle between them
Two adjacent sides and one diagonal

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT sufficient to construct a unique parallelogram?

ordering_items: Draw the given angle
With vertex as center, draw an arc cutting both arms
From the two intersection points, draw arcs of equal radius intersecting each other
Join the vertex to the intersection point of the arcs
The line drawn is the angle bisector
correct_answer: Draw the given angle
With vertex as center, draw an arc cutting both arms
From the two intersection points, draw arcs of equal radius intersecting each other
Join the vertex to the intersection point of the arcs
The line drawn is the angle bisector
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps for bisecting an angle in the correct order.

match_pairs.right: All sides equal, opposite angles equal
Exactly one pair of parallel sides

questions.question_text: Match each quadrilateral with its defining property.
A regular hexagon can be constructed by drawing six equilateral triangles around a common center.

options.text: Equidistant from the endpoints of the segment
Closer to one endpoint than the other

questions.question_text: All points on the perpendicular bisector of a line segment are:
In a triangle with sides 5 cm, 12 cm, and 13 cm, the triangle is a _____ triangle.
How many triangles are formed when all diagonals from one vertex of a regular hexagon are drawn?

ordering_items: Draw the given line segment AB
With A as center and radius more than half of AB, draw arcs above and below AB
With B as center and same radius, draw arcs intersecting the previous arcs
Mark the intersection points as P and Q
Join P and Q to get the perpendicular bisector
correct_answer: Draw the given line segment AB
With A as center and radius more than half of AB, draw arcs above and below AB
With B as center and same radius, draw arcs intersecting the previous arcs
Mark the intersection points as P and Q
Join P and Q to get the perpendicular bisector
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to construct the perpendicular bisector of a line segment in the correct order.
A 90° angle can be constructed by drawing perpendicular lines using a compass.
The diagonals of a rhombus bisect each other at _____ angles.
Match the angle with the method of construction.
Construct a triangle ABC where AB = 6 cm, BC = 7 cm, and ∠B = 60°. Which construction method should be used?

options.text: Construct triangle ABC first, then complete the parallelogram

questions.question_text: To construct a parallelogram ABCD with AB = 5 cm, BC = 7 cm, and ∠ABC = 75°, which construction approach is most efficient?
In a triangle PQR, if PQ = 8 cm, ∠P = 45°, and ∠Q = 60°, the third angle ∠R = _____ degrees.
A quadrilateral with one pair of parallel sides and two right angles must be a rectangle.
When constructing a regular hexagon inscribed in a circle of radius 4 cm, what should be the compass width for marking the vertices?

ordering_items: Draw diagonal AC = 8 cm
Construct the perpendicular bisector of AC to find its midpoint O
With A as center and radius 6 cm, draw arcs above and below AC
With C as center and radius 6 cm, draw arcs intersecting the previous arcs at B and D
Join AB, BC, CD, and DA to complete the rhombus
correct_answer: Draw diagonal AC = 8 cm
Construct the perpendicular bisector of AC to find its midpoint O
With A as center and radius 6 cm, draw arcs above and below AC
With C as center and radius 6 cm, draw arcs intersecting the previous arcs at B and D
Join AB, BC, CD, and DA to complete the rhombus
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to construct a rhombus ABCD with side 6 cm and diagonal AC = 8 cm.
The angle bisectors of a triangle intersect at a point called the:
The perpendicular bisectors of the sides of a triangle meet at a point called the _____, which is equidistant from all three vertices.

match_pairs.left: Right angle, hypotenuse: 10 cm, side: 6 cm

questions.question_text: Match each triangle construction scenario with the appropriate method.
To construct a 135° angle, you can construct a 90° angle and a 45° angle adjacent to each other.

options.text: Draw PQ = 8 cm as the base
Draw SR = 5 cm as the base

questions.question_text: In constructing a trapezium PQRS with PQ parallel to SR, PQ = 8 cm, SR = 5 cm, PS = 4 cm, and ∠P = 70°, which element should be constructed first?
When a regular hexagon is inscribed in a circle, each side of the hexagon equals the _____ of the circle.
A triangle ABC has AB = 7 cm, AC = 5 cm, and ∠A = 120°. After construction, the approximate length of BC will be:

ordering_items: Draw a circle with radius 5 cm and mark the center O
Mark any point A on the circle
With A as center and radius 5 cm, mark point B on the circle
Continue marking points C, D, E, F with the same radius
Join consecutive points to form the regular hexagon
correct_answer: Draw a circle with radius 5 cm and mark the center O
Mark any point A on the circle
With A as center and radius 5 cm, mark point B on the circle
Continue marking points C, D, E, F with the same radius
Join consecutive points to form the regular hexagon
questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to construct a regular hexagon inscribed in a circle of radius 5 cm.
The three angle bisectors of any triangle always meet at a single point inside the triangle.

options.text: The angle bisector of ∠AOB where O is any point

questions.question_text: If you need to locate a point that is equidistant from two given points A and B, you should construct:
